org.letras.psi.semantic
Interface ISemanticService

public interface ISemanticService

An ISemanticService provides some sort of semantic-discovering service for IRegions. Handwriting recognition and gesture recognition are examples of such services. This interface allows configuring the semantic service to use a specific ISegmentationProvider and to specify which regions the semantic service should be provided for.

Author:
Jannik Jochem

Method Summary
 void addRegion(IRegion region)
          Start observing region.
 void removeRegion(IRegion region)
          Stop observing region.
 void setSegmenter(ISegmentationProvider segmenter)
          Sets the segmenter the service should use for identifying which traces to work on.
 

Method Detail

setSegmenter

void setSegmenter(ISegmentationProvider segmenter)
Sets the segmenter the service should use for identifying which traces to work on. If regions are already being observed, these are registered with the segmenter as well.

Parameters:
segmenter -

addRegion

void addRegion(IRegion region)
Start observing region. If a segmenter is already set, the region will be registered with the segmenter as observed by this service.

Parameters:
region -

removeRegion

void removeRegion(IRegion region)
Stop observing region. If a segmenter is already set, the segmenter will be notified that this service no longer observes the region.

Parameters:
region -
